alert.note: Alert for Lake (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 12:06AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Lake. * WHEN...Until 300 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1204 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in Scotts Creek and possible flooding of Scotts Valley road. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Scotts Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lakeport, Middletown, Upper Lake, Clearlake, Konocti Bay, Glenhaven, Mount Konocti, Soda Bay, Seigler Springs, Loch Lomond, Adams, Ettawa Springs, Hobergs, Forest Lake, Whispering Pines, Finley, Anderson Springs, Hough Springs, Barkerville and North Lakeport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
